description: From Urdu درگاہ‎ (dargāh), from Persian درگاه‎ (dargâh). See also English eidgah.

entries.meaning: (Islam, South Asia, India, Pakistan) A shrine associated with the grave of a Muslim saint or similar religious figure.
examples: If not for the fakir's dargah the village might well have melted back into the mud, its inhabitants not being the kind of people to tarry long in one place […].
